column4: Hi. I have an old Toshiba Tecra laptop, and it has an IrDA infra red port. Can anyone here help me to get it working in Feisty?
see lsmod if the IrDa modules are already loaded (should be)
I see irda listed...
good, so sudo apt-get install irda-utils
ok, I got the irda-utils....
did it tak you through some configuration during install ?
no.
so sudo dpkg-reconfigure irda-utils (just to make sure it ot everything right)
it's asking me if I want to use a serial dongle or "native"... I don't know what that means. Do I just choose "native"?
no on an old Tosh you need serial
native is only for USB dongles
it's giving me a list of dongle types to choose now.... I don't know what any of them are. Do I just choose "none"?
yup... it's internal anyway
ok, the config thing has exited now
so see 'ifconfig' if a network adater is configured for IrDa now
I have no idea.. what am I looking for in ifconfig's output?
put your irda device in front of the Interface and run 'cat /proc/net/irda/discovery
I don't have an IR device. My goal is to get this to work with LIRC plug-ins so I can see if it works with remote controls....
anyay I did cat /proc/net/irda/discovery but nothing seemed to happen... it just says IrLMP; Discovery Log:
That won't work. IR receivers and IrDa interfaces are completly different Hardware
oh.. I thought I read somewhere that IRDA interfaces can be used with LIRC?
only in /very/ rare cases.
and even if it works somehow, it'll be unreliable and unusable in practice
